00025 #include "lpc17xx_mcpwm.h"
00026 #include "lpc17xx_pinsel.h"
00027 #include "lpc17xx_libcfg.h"
00028 #include "lpc17xx_clkpwr.h"

00032 /* Example group ----------------------------------------------------------- */
00038 /************************** PRIVATE DEFINITIONS **********************/
00040 #define DC_MODE_TEST                    1
00041 
00042 #define AC_MODE_TEST                    0
00043 
00044 #define CAPTURE_MODE_TEST               0
00045 
00046 
00047 /************************** PRIVATE VARIABLES *************************/
00048 #if CAPTURE_MODE_TEST
00049 
00050 MCPWM_CAPTURE_CFG_Type captureCfg;
00052 __IO FlagStatus CapFlag;
00054 __IO uint32_t CapVal;
00055 #endif
00056 /************************** PRIVATE FUNCTIONS *************************/
00057 void MCPWM_IRQHandler(void);
00058 
00059 /*----------------- INTERRUPT SERVICE ROUTINES --------------------------*/
00060 /*********************************************************************/
00065 void MCPWM_IRQHandler(void)
00066 {
00067 #if CAPTURE_MODE_TEST
00068         // Check whether if capture event interrupt is set
00069         if (MCPWM_GetIntStatus(LPC_MCPWM, MCPWM_INTFLAG_CAP0)) {
00070                 if (CapFlag == RESET) {
00071                         // Store capture value
00072                         CapVal = MCPWM_GetCapture(LPC_MCPWM, 0);
00073                         // toggle capture flag
00074                         CapFlag = SET;
00075                         // Disable interrupt for capture event
00076                         MCPWM_IntConfig(LPC_MCPWM, MCPWM_INTFLAG_CAP0, DISABLE);
00077                 }
00078                 // Clear pending interrupt
00079                 MCPWM_IntClear(LPC_MCPWM, MCPWM_INTFLAG_CAP0);
00080         }
00081 #endif
00082 }
00083 
00084 
00085 /*-------------------------MAIN FUNCTION------------------------------*/
00086 /*********************************************************************/
00091 int c_entry(void)
00092 {
00093         // MCPWM Channel configuration data
00094         MCPWM_CHANNEL_CFG_Type channelsetup[3];
00095         uint32_t i;
00096         PINSEL_CFG_Type PinCfg;
00097 
00098         /* Initialize debug via UART0
00099          * – 115200bps
00100          * – 8 data bit
00101          * – No parity
00102          * – 1 stop bit
00103          * – No flow control
00104          */
00105         debug_frmwrk_init();
00106         _DBG_("Hello MCPWM ...");
00107 
00108         /* Pin configuration for MCPWM function:
00109          * Assign:      - P1.19 as MCOA0 - Motor Control Channel 0 Output A
00110          *                      - P1.22 as MCOB0 - Motor Control Channel 0 Output B
00111          *                      - P1.25 as MCOA1 - Motor Control Channel 1 Output A
00112          *                      - P1.26 as MCOB1 - Motor Control Channel 1 Output B
00113          *                      - P1.28 as MCOA2 - Motor Control Channel 2 Output A
00114          *                      - P1.29 as MCOB2 - Motor Control Channel 2 Output B
00115          *                      - P1.20 as MCI0  - Motor Control Feed Back Channel 0
00116          * Warning: According to Errata.lpc1768-18.March.2010: Input pin (MIC0-2)
00117          * on the Motor Control PWM peripheral are not functional
00118          */
00119         PinCfg.Funcnum = 1;
00120         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00121         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00122         PinCfg.Portnum = 1;
00123         PinCfg.Pinnum = 19;
00124         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00125         PinCfg.Pinnum = 22;
00126         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00127         PinCfg.Pinnum = 25;
00128         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00129         PinCfg.Pinnum = 26;
00130         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00131         PinCfg.Pinnum = 28;
00132         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00133         PinCfg.Pinnum = 29;
00134         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00135         PinCfg.Pinnum = 20;
00136         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00137 
00138         /* Disable interrupt for MCPWM  */
00139         NVIC_DisableIRQ(MCPWM_IRQn);
00140         /* preemption = 1, sub-priority = 1 */
00141         NVIC_SetPriority(MCPWM_IRQn, ((0x01<<3)|0x01));
00142 
00143         /* Init MCPWM peripheral */
00144         MCPWM_Init(LPC_MCPWM);
00145 
00146         channelsetup[0].channelType = MCPWM_CHANNEL_EDGE_MODE;
00147         channelsetup[0].channelPolarity = MCPWM_CHANNEL_PASSIVE_LO;
00148         channelsetup[0].channelDeadtimeEnable = DISABLE;
00149         channelsetup[0].channelDeadtimeValue = 0;
00150         channelsetup[0].channelUpdateEnable = ENABLE;
00151         channelsetup[0].channelTimercounterValue = 0;
00152         channelsetup[0].channelPeriodValue = 300;
00153         channelsetup[0].channelPulsewidthValue = 0;
00154 
00155         channelsetup[1].channelType = MCPWM_CHANNEL_EDGE_MODE;
00156         channelsetup[1].channelPolarity = MCPWM_CHANNEL_PASSIVE_LO;
00157         channelsetup[1].channelDeadtimeEnable = DISABLE;
00158         channelsetup[1].channelDeadtimeValue = 0;
00159         channelsetup[1].channelUpdateEnable = ENABLE;
00160         channelsetup[1].channelTimercounterValue = 0;
00161         channelsetup[1].channelPeriodValue = 300;
00162         channelsetup[1].channelPulsewidthValue = 100;
00163 
00164         channelsetup[2].channelType = MCPWM_CHANNEL_EDGE_MODE;
00165         channelsetup[2].channelPolarity = MCPWM_CHANNEL_PASSIVE_LO;
00166         channelsetup[2].channelDeadtimeEnable = DISABLE;
00167         channelsetup[2].channelDeadtimeValue = 0;
00168         channelsetup[2].channelUpdateEnable = ENABLE;
00169         channelsetup[2].channelTimercounterValue = 0;
00170         channelsetup[2].channelPeriodValue = 300;
00171         channelsetup[2].channelPulsewidthValue = 200;
00172 
00173         MCPWM_ConfigChannel(LPC_MCPWM, 0, &channelsetup[0]);
00174         MCPWM_ConfigChannel(LPC_MCPWM, 1, &channelsetup[1]);
00175         MCPWM_ConfigChannel(LPC_MCPWM, 2, &channelsetup[2]);
00176 
00177 #if DC_MODE_TEST
00178         /*
00179          * - DC mode enabled.
00180          * - Invert Output enabled
00181          * - A0 and A1 output pin is internally routed to A0 signal
00182          */
00183         MCPWM_DCMode(LPC_MCPWM, ENABLE, ENABLE, (MCPWM_PATENT_A0|MCPWM_PATENT_A1));
00184 #endif
00185 
00186 #if AC_MODE_TEST
00187         /*
00188          * - AC mode is enabled.
00189          */
00190         MCPWM_ACMode(LPC_MCPWM, ENABLE);
00191 #endif
00192 
00193 #if CAPTURE_MODE_TEST
00194         /*
00195          * Capture mode in this case is used to detect the falling edge on MCO0B output pin.
00196          * The MCFB0 input pin therefore must be connected to MCO0B. (P1.20 - P1.22)
00197          * - Capture Channel 0.
00198          * - Capture falling edge on MCFB0 input pin.
00199          * - Interrupt enabled on capture event.
00200          */
00201         captureCfg.captureChannel = 0;
00202         captureCfg.captureFalling = ENABLE;
00203         captureCfg.captureRising = DISABLE;
00204         captureCfg.hnfEnable = DISABLE;
00205         captureCfg.timerReset = DISABLE;
00206         MCPWM_ConfigCapture(LPC_MCPWM, 0, &captureCfg);
00207 
00208         // Reset flag for the first time
00209         CapFlag = RESET;
00210 
00211         // Enable interrupt for capture event on MCI0 (MCFB0)
00212         MCPWM_IntConfig(LPC_MCPWM, MCPWM_INTFLAG_CAP0, ENABLE);
00213 
00214         /* Enable interrupt for MCPWM  */
00215         NVIC_EnableIRQ(MCPWM_IRQn);
00216 #endif
00217 
00218         MCPWM_Start(LPC_MCPWM, ENABLE, ENABLE, ENABLE);
00219 
00220         // Main loop
00221         while (1) {
00222 //              Timer_Wait(LPC_TIM0, 1000);
00223                 //delay
00224                 for(i=0;i<100000;i++);
00225 
00226                 channelsetup[0].channelPulsewidthValue = (channelsetup[0].channelPulsewidthValue >= 300) ?
00227                                                                                                 0 : channelsetup[0].channelPulsewidthValue + 20;
00228                 channelsetup[1].channelPulsewidthValue = (channelsetup[1].channelPulsewidthValue >= 300) ?
00229                                                                                                 0 : channelsetup[1].channelPulsewidthValue + 20;
00230                 channelsetup[2].channelPulsewidthValue = (channelsetup[2].channelPulsewidthValue >= 300) ?
00231                                                                                                 0 : channelsetup[2].channelPulsewidthValue + 20;
00232                 _DBG_("Update!");
00233                 MCPWM_WriteToShadow(LPC_MCPWM, 0, &channelsetup[0]);
00234                 MCPWM_WriteToShadow(LPC_MCPWM, 1, &channelsetup[1]);
00235                 MCPWM_WriteToShadow(LPC_MCPWM, 2, &channelsetup[2]);
00236 #if CAPTURE_MODE_TEST
00237                 // Check capture flag is set or not
00238                 if (CapFlag) {
00239                         // Print out the value
00240                         _DBG("Capture Value: ");
00241                         _DBD32(CapVal); _DBG_("");
00242 
00243                         // Setup a new capture event
00244                         MCPWM_ConfigCapture(LPC_MCPWM, 0, &captureCfg);
00245 
00246                         // Re-Enable interrupt for capture event on MCI0 (MCFB0)
00247                         MCPWM_IntConfig(LPC_MCPWM, MCPWM_INTFLAG_CAP0, ENABLE);
00248 
00249                         // Reset flag
00250                         CapFlag = RESET;
00251                 }
00252 #endif
00253         }
00254 }
00255 
00256 /* With ARM and GHS toolsets, the entry point is main() - this will
00257    allow the linker to generate wrapper code to setup stacks, allocate
00258    heap area, and initialize and copy code and data segments. For GNU
00259    toolsets, the entry point is through __start() in the crt0_gnu.asm
00260    file, and that startup code will setup stacks and data */
00261 int main(void)
00262 {
00263     return c_entry();
00264 }

00267 #ifdef  DEBUG
00268 /*******************************************************************************
00269 * @brief                Reports the name of the source file and the source line number
00270 *                               where the CHECK_PARAM error has occurred.
00271 * @param[in]    file Pointer to the source file name
00272 * @param[in]    line assert_param error line source number
00273 * @return               None
00274 *******************************************************************************/
00275 void check_failed(uint8_t *file, uint32_t line)
00276 {
00277         /* User can add his own implementation to report the file name and line number,
00278          ex: printf("Wrong parameters value: file %s on line %d\r\n", file, line) */
00279 
00280         /* Infinite loop */
00281         while(1);
00282 }
00283 #endif
